verses.roman:
sindhos taṭaṁ candrabhāgāṁ
kauntīṁ kāśmīra-maṇḍalam
bhokṣyanti śūdrā vrātyādyā
mlecchāś cābrahma-varcasaḥ

synonyms: sindhoḥ—of the River Sindhu; taṭam—the land on the shore; candrabhāgām—Candrabhāgā; kauntīm—Kauntī; kāśmīra-maṇḍalam—the region of Kāśmīra; bhokṣyanti—will rule; śūdrāḥ—śūdras; vrātya-ādyāḥ—brāhmaṇas who have fallen from the brahminical standard, and other disqualified men; mlecchāḥ—meat-eaters; ca—and; abrahma-varcasaḥ—lacking spiritual potency.
translation: The land along the Sindhu River, as well as the districts of Candrabhāgā, Kauntī and Kāśmīra, will be ruled by śūdras, fallen brāhmaṇas and meat-eaters. Having given up the path of Vedic civilization, they will have lost all spiritual strength.
